metadata.title: Build Public Booking Portal Step Flow UI
metadata.dependencies: HEALIO-004, HEALIO-005, HEALIO-006, HEALIO-017, HEALIO-018, HEALIO-020
metadata.prd_reference: Feature 1 Patient Booking Portal + user Viedoc/Stripe guidance

context.background: This task implements Build Public Booking Portal Step Flow UI for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Use Stripe-like frictionless workflows: create/edit actions should open centered modals or slide-out drawers instead of disruptive full-page forms.
Use a Viedoc-style bento layout: soft floating white cards on an off-white background for dashboards and dense data views.
Apply the Paper Replacement palette: app background near #F9FAFB, white cards, calm trustworthy accents (teal/sage/cerulean), and reserve red for critical alerts only.
Preserve high-legibility typography: clean sans-serif (Inter/SF Pro/Halyard), bold patient names, slate-gray secondary metadata.
Honor the one-click rule where applicable: keep the global + action for Add Appointment, Add Patient, and Create Invoice visible and easy to reach.
Add educational empty states with clear CTAs for first-time or empty datasets.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Build Public Booking Portal Step Flow UI in the planned files (healio/app/(public)/book/[slug]/page.tsx, healio/components/appointments/public-booking-service-selector.tsx, healio/components/appointments/public-booking-provider-selector.tsx, healio/components/appointments/public-slot-picker.tsx ...) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.

Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/public/clinics/:slug, GET /api/v1/public/clinics/:slug/services, GET /api/v1/public/clinics/:slug/slots) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Prefer in-context modal/drawer workflows, scannable bento cards, and educational empty states so the UI matches the requested Healio experience.
Verify keyboard/focus behavior, touch target sizing, and mobile responsiveness before marking the task ready.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/public/clinics/:slug, GET /api/v1/public/clinics/:slug/services, GET /api/v1/public/clinics/:slug/slots and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Manually verify desktop and mobile layouts plus focus/keyboard behavior for the primary interaction path.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify the implemented UI in-browser (desktop + mobile), check interactions, inspect console errors, and capture a validation snapshot before marking done.
Capture a screenshot or short note confirming empty/loading/error states are present where applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Build Public Booking Portal Step Flow UI is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 1 Patient Booking Portal + user Viedoc/Stripe guidance) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
UI states (loading, empty, error, success) are present and visually consistent with Healio bento cards, off-white background, and trust-oriented styling.
Interactions are keyboard accessible and usable on mobile without disruptive navigation when a modal/drawer workflow is appropriate.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; Chrome DevTools MCP: /book/northview-clinic desktop snapshot + service/slot interactions + mobile resize (390x844) + console check; network reqids 283-286 for clinic/services/slots GETs
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented the public booking step-flow UI (service -> provider -> time) with a Viedoc-style bento layout, off-white background, and high-legibility cards. React Query hook wires the public clinic/services/slots APIs. Verified desktop and mobile layouts plus service/slot interactions in Chrome DevTools MCP. Error state was also observed under the intended public API rate limit (429) during repeated reloads, then re-verified after cooldown.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (snapshot/screenshot reference and notes on responsive + interaction checks) here before marking frontend tasks complete.
Chrome DevTools MCP desktop snapshot (`/book/northview-clinic`): snapshot root `uid=38_0` shows clinic hero, progress cards, service/provider/slot sections, and summary sidebar in the bento layout.

Chrome DevTools MCP API verification via page network requests: reqid=283 (`GET /api/v1/public/clinics/northview-clinic`) [200], reqid=284 (`.../services`) [200], reqid=285 (`.../slots?...svc-general-consult`) [200], reqid=286 (`.../slots?...svc-follow-up`) [200].

Chrome DevTools MCP interaction checks: clicked service card (`uid=38_25`) to switch to Follow-up Consultation and clicked slot button (`uid=39_0`) to select 09:00; summary card and progress badges updated; Continue button enabled.
Keyboard/focus check: `Tab` navigation moved focus into the native date input controls (snapshot focus on date spinbutton uid `41_2`), confirming keyboard reachable controls and visible focus states.
Chrome DevTools MCP mobile verification: resized viewport to 390x844 and captured snapshot (same root `uid=38_0`) confirming stacked mobile layout and large tap-target buttons.
Console check: `list_console_messages` returned no console messages after final reload/build.

Error-state note (required UI states): during repeated verification requests, the page displayed the services error card with "Too many requests. Please retry shortly." when the public API rate limit (5 req/min) was hit, confirming error-state rendering under API failures.
Implementation commit: f14667a (feat(healio-booking): booking portal step flow ui).
